item.title: A Kabbalistic Healing Prayer/Meditation אֵל, נָא רְפָא נָא לָהּ
item.description:
The Hebrew lyrics are a prayer of Moses, asking for the healing of his sister Miriam (Numbers 12:13). These Healing lyrics have been spoken for thousands of years.

EL Na Rifa Na Lah אֵל, נָא רְפָא נָא לָהּ

El = God, divine Power

na = please, now, I pray

refa = heal

na = please, now, I pray

lah = her

Lyrics: Hebrew: Numbers 12:13 English: Rabbi Shai Specht

Music: Rabbi Shai Specht

A Love & Light Production ©
item.dc:creator: Rabbi Shai Specht
item.itunes:summary: The Hebrew lyrics are a prayer of Moses, asking for the healing of his sister Miriam (Numbers 12:13). These Healing lyrics have been spoken for thousands of years. EL Na Rifa Na Lah אֵל, נָא רְפָא נָא לָהּ El = God, divine Power na = please, now, I pray refa = heal na = please, now, I pray lah = her Lyrics: Hebrew: Numbers 12:13 English: Rabbi Shai Specht Music: Rabbi Shai Specht A Love & Light Production ©

item.title: Ana B'Koach (A Powerful Kabbalistic Prayer)
item.description:
Lyrics: Liturgy/Rabbi Shai Specht

Music: Rabbi Shai Specht

A Love & Light Publication © 2011

Ana B'khoach is one of the masterpieces of mystical prayer. It addresses The Divine at a level that is beyond the names for Creator that we normally use. This special language makes it a very powerful prayer, whether it's said in (well-translated) English or Hebrew.
item.dc:creator: Rabbi Shai Specht
item.itunes:summary: Lyrics: Liturgy/Rabbi Shai Specht Music: Rabbi Shai Specht A Love & Light Publication © 2011 Ana B'khoach is one of the masterpieces of mystical prayer. It addresses The Divine at a level that is beyond the names for Creator that we normally use. This special language makes it a very powerful prayer, whether it's said in (well-translated) English or Hebrew.

item.title: Hashkiveinu (Lay us down)
item.description: Lyrics/Music/Vocals: Rabbi Shai Specht© Lay us down to sleep, Hashem, in peace. Raise us erect, our King, to life; and spread over us the shelter of Your peace. Set us aright with good counsel from before Your Presence, and save us for Your Name's sake.

item.title: Giving Them an "A" (another Radio Interview)
item.description: “Treat people like angels; you will meet some and help make some.” When Rabbi Shai Specht posted that tweet several days ago, I knew I had to have him on my show. The idea of treating people like angels goes along with my philosophy of "Giving Them an 'A'" However, Reb Shai taught me something about the nature of angels that went way beyond what I expected. http://whisperedbyhorses.com/
item.dc:creator: Rabbi Shai Specht
item.itunes:summary:
“Treat people like angels; you will meet some and help make some.”
When Rabbi Shai Specht posted that tweet several days ago, I knew I had to have him on my show. The idea of treating people like angels goes along with my philosophy of "Giving Them an 'A'"
However, Reb Shai taught me something about the nature of angels that went way beyond what I expected.
http://whisperedbyhorses.com/

item.title: A Nigun ניגון
item.description: Nigun is a Hebrew term meaning “humming tune.” Usually, the term refers to Spiritual songs and tunes. It is a form of voice instrumental music, often without any lyrics or words, although sounds like “bim-bim-bam” or “Ai-ai-ai!” are often used.
item.dc:creator: Rabbi Shai Specht
item.itunes:summary: Nigun is a Hebrew term meaning “humming tune.” Usually, the term refers to Spiritual songs and tunes. It is a form of voice instrumental music, often without any lyrics or words, although sounds like “bim-bim-bam” or “Ai-ai-ai!” are often used.

item.title: Ma Tovu מה טבו
item.description: How goodly are your tents, O Jacob, your dwelling places, O Israel! And I, with Your great loving-kindness, shall enter Your House; I shall prostrate myself toward Your Holy Temple in the fear of You. O Lord, I love the dwelling of Your house and the place of the residence of Your glory. Come, let us prostrate ourselves and bow; let us kneel before the Lord, our Maker. But, as for me, may my prayer to You, O Lord, be in an acceptable time. O God, with Your abundant kindness, answer me with the truth of Your salvation.
item.dc:creator: Rabbi Shai Specht
item.itunes:summary: How goodly are your tents, O Jacob, your dwelling places, O Israel! And I, with Your great loving-kindness, shall enter Your House; I shall prostrate myself toward Your Holy Temple in the fear of You. O Lord, I love the dwelling of Your house and the place of the residence of Your glory. Come, let us prostrate ourselves and bow; let us kneel before the Lord, our Maker. But, as for me, may my prayer to You, O Lord, be in an acceptable time. O God, with Your abundant kindness, answer me with the truth of Your salvation.

item.title: The Priestly Blessing
item.description: Rabbi Shai gives you a Blessing May God bless you and keep you – יְבָרֶכְךָ יְהוָה, וְיִשְׁמְרֶךָ Shine upon you – יָאֵר יְהוָה פָּנָיו אֵלֶיךָ, וִיחֻנֶּךָּ And give you peace – יִשָּׂא יְהוָה פָּנָיו אֵלֶיךָ, וְיָשֵׂם לְךָ שָׁלוֹם MadCash Records Producer: Scarbaby

item.title: Reflections...
item.description: The DIVINE BEING understands our prayers Even when we can't find the words to say them. Peace on the outside comes from knowing SHEKHINAH on the inside. When we lose GOD, it is not GOD who is lost. Availability is better than ability for The CREATOR. Exercise daily. Walk with THE LIGHT! Darkness cannot put out the Light. It can only make THE ONE brighter. Weave in faith and CREATOR will find the thread.
item.dc:creator: Rabbi Shai Specht
item.itunes:summary:
The DIVINE BEING understands our prayers Even when we can't find the words to say them.
Peace on the outside comes from knowing SHEKHINAH on the inside.
When we lose GOD, it is not GOD who is lost.
Availability is better than ability for The CREATOR.
Exercise daily. Walk with THE LIGHT!
Darkness cannot put out the Light. It can only make THE ONE brighter.
Weave in faith and CREATOR will find the thread.

item.title: The Shekhinah
item.description: According to Jewish mystical tradition, God is both masculine and feminine. The Shekhinah represents the female manifistation of deity. In this podcast you will learn about the Shkhinah and how to connect with her in order to recieve healing and inner peace.
item.dc:creator: Rabbi Shai Specht
item.itunes:summary: According to Jewish mystical tradition, God is both masculine and feminine. The Shekhinah represents the female manifistation of deity. In this podcast you will learn about the Shkhinah and how to connect with her in order to recieve healing and inner peace.
